sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: This tutorial walks the user through the steps necessary to construct, run, and view the results of a benchmark problem (SCEC Bemchmark 5). This problem examines the viscoelatic (Maxwell) relaxation of stress from a single, finite, dip-slip earthquake in 3-D without body forces.

sect2.title: Problem Description
sect2.para: The model domain is 24 km by 24 km by 24 km (0 km <= x <= 24 km; 0 km >= y <= 24 km; -24 km <= z <= 0). The model domain is composed to two materials. One material occupies the top-half of the domain -12 km <= z <= 0km while the other occupies the lower half, -24km <= z < 12 km. Both materials are Poisson solids with Lame's constants (mu and lambda) equal to 30 GPa with Maxwell viscoelastic properties. The top layer has a viscosity of 10^{25} Pa-s (and is essentially elastic) while the bottom layer has a viscosity of 10^{18} Pa-s.

The reverse fault dips at an angle 45 degrees. The top of the fault sits at x = 4 km with the bottom of the fault at x = 20km. The fault surface is confined to the region 0 km <= y <= 16 km and -16 km <= z <= 0 km. The slip distribution is 1.0 m of uniform thrust motion for -12 km <= z with a linear taper to 0 at z =- 16 km.
The boundary conditions on the lateral and bottom edges of the mesh are the displacements from the analytical elastic solution. These displacements are held fixed through time.

sect2.title: Prerequisites
sect2.para: You should have already installed PyLith-0.8. In this tutorial we assume that you are using NetGen (http://www.hpfem.jku.at/netgen/) to generate the mesh and ParaView (http://www.paraview.org) to view simulation results. You may use other packages, but some adaption (not covered here) will be necessary.

listitem.para: Download the tutorial tarball (http://www.geodynamics.org:8080/cig/Members/willic3/pylithusers/lithomopinstallation/downloads/unworked_benchmarks.tar.gz) and unpack it in a location of your choosing. You may also wish to download the worked example tarball (http://www.geodynamics.org:8080/cig/Members/willic3/pylithusers/lithomopinstallation/downloads/worked_benchmarks.tar.gz) to compare your results or start at an intermediate step.

Once you have unpacked the tarball, you will have an "unworked_benchmarks" directory. Go to the "utils" sub-directory and edit the makefile as appropriate (it is presently setup for g77). You will need to make the following executables in order to generate the inputs files for PyLith-0.8 from NetGen output.
